column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0006]The combination of the abovementioned techniques makes it possible to greatly improve the throughput.
#Text=In the vector scanning method, however, the deflection angle of an electron beam to be directed to a subfield varies depending on the position of the subfield within a frame.
#Text=Due to the variation, the accuracy of the shape, position and size of a writing pattern may be degraded.

#Text=Japanese patent laid-open No. 284392/1998 (Hei 10-284392) discloses a method for detecting a variation (occurring depending on the position of a spot of an electron beam deflected by a main deflector) in sensitivity of a sub deflector before formation of a pattern and correcting the detected value for the formation of the pattern.
#Text=[0007]It is necessary that an electron beam be deflected at a high speed and with high accuracy to improve the throughput.

#Text=In order to drive a deflector by means of a deflection amplifier, however, a period of time (settling time) for settling an output voltage corresponding to a load for driving the deflector is required.
#Text=In other words, a predetermined settling time is required to settle the output voltage in order to set the spot of a deflected electron beam to a target position.
#Text=In addition, when the surface of a sample is irradiated with an electron beam during the settling time, a pattern written onto the sample is adversely affected.
#Text=It is therefore necessary that a blanking mechanism be operated during the settling time to prevent the sample from being irradiated with the electron beam.

#Text=[0008]It is desirable that the time for starting an operation of a blanking mechanism (hereinafter referred to as the blanking start time) be identical to the timing for applying a voltage to a sub deflector when changing a position to be irradiated with the charged-particle beam.
#Text=Thus, while the waveform of the output voltage is confirmed by an oscilloscope, the blanking start time is determined.
#Text=In this method, however, there may occur adjustment errors on an individual basis.
#Text=When the voltage is applied to the sub deflector before the blanking start time, an unnecessary region may be irradiated with the electron beam.
#Text=Therefore, the accuracy of writing may be reduced.
#Text=In a conventional technique, the voltage is applied to the sub deflector after a predetermined time elapses from the blanking start time.
#Text=[0009]The settling time is identical to a period of time for blanking.
#Text=Thus, when the voltage is applied to the sub deflector after a predetermined time elapses from the blanking start time, the substantial settling time is reduced.
#Text=This may result in the fact that formation of a pattern is started before output of the sub deflector is stabilized.
#Text=Especially when the movement distance of the electron-beam irradiation position is large, the voltage to be applied to the sub deflector is large.
#Text=It therefore takes a certain time to stabilize the output of the sub deflector.
#Text=In this case, there is a higher possibility that formation of a pattern is started before the output of the sub deflector is stabilized.
#Text=If the formation is started after the output of the sub deflector is stabilized, however, the settling time becomes longer, and the throughput is reduced.

#Text=[0010]It is, therefore, an object of the present invention to provide a charged-particle writing apparatus and charged-particle writing method, which are capable of suppressing a reduction in accuracy of writing and improving the throughput of the apparatus.
